scripts.name: List available scripts
scripts.description: Displays all available CLI scripts in the manifest

scripts.name: Git clone and enter directory
scripts.description: Clones a git project using a git URL or a repository name (with -b/--basic flag) and then navigates into the newly created directory

scripts.name: Git push (with upstream setting)
scripts.description: Will check if there's an upstream branch that matches current branch, calls 'git push' if upstream exists, creates it if it doesn't

scripts.name: Go to repo
scripts.description: Opens the GitHub repo in the default browser. Use '-cb' or '--current-branch' to open the current branch if it exists remotely.

scripts.name: Go to projects
scripts.description: Navigates to the projects folder, defined by the PROJECTS_PATH variable in config file

scripts.name: List projects
scripts.description: Lists folders in projects, accepts all flags provided by ls command

scripts.name: Go sln
scripts.description: Opens the first .sln file it finds by default, or all .sln files (including nested ones) when using the -a/--all flag

scripts.name: Git Status Viewer
scripts.description: Provides a detailed overview of the current Git repository, including branch, untracked files, changes, and upstream status.
